ARTICLE 1: HDFC Life Results
Source: Economic Times
URL: https://m.economictimes.com/markets/stocks/earnings/hdfc-life-q1-results-standalone-profit-rises-14-yoy-to-rs-546-crore-net-premium-income-grows-16/articleshow/122502983.cms
Content Length: 526 characters
================================================================================

HDFC Life Insurance reported a 14% YoY increase in net profit, reaching ₹546 crore for Q1FY26, 
driven by a 16% rise in net premium income. The company's Individual APE grew by 12.5% YoY, 
boosting its market share to 12.1% overall and 17.5% within the private sector. (What's 
movingSensexandNiftyTracklatest market news,stock tips,Budget 2025,Share Market on Budget 
2025andexpert advice, onETMarkets. Also, ETMarkets.com is now on Telegram. For fastest news alerts 
on financial markets, investment strategies and stocks alerts,


================================================================================

incorporated in the year 1994, is a banking company (having a market cap of Rs 15,00,917.42 
Crore).HDFC Bank Ltd. key Products/Revenue Segments include Interest & Discount on Advances & 
Bills, Income From Investment, Interest and Interest On Balances with RBI and Other Inter-Bank 
Funds for the year ending 31-Mar-2024.The Bank has reported Standalone Non Performing Assets (Gross 
NPAs) at .00 % of total assets and Standalone Net Non Performing Assets (Net NPAs) at .00% of total 
assets for the quarter ending 31-03-2025.For the quarter ended 31-03-2025, the company has reported 
a Consolidated Total Income of Rs 120,268.76 Crore, up 7.20 % from last quarter Total Income of Rs 
112,193.94 Crore and down 3.31 % from last year same quarter Total Income of Rs 124,391.35 Crore. 
The bank has reported net profit after tax of Rs 18,834.88 Crore in latest quarter.The bank’s top 
management includes Mr.Atanu Chakraborty, Mr.Sashidhar Jagdishan, Mr.Kaizad Bharucha, Mr.Bhavesh 
Zaveri, Mr.V Srinivasa Rangan, Mr.Keki Mistry, Mrs.Renu Karnad, Dr.Harsh Kumar Bhanwala, Mrs.Lily 
Vadera, Mr.M D Ranganath, Mr.Sandeep Parekh, Dr.(Mrs.)Sunita Maheshwari, Mr.Srinivasan 
Vaidyanathan, Mr.Santosh Haldankar, Mr.Rakesh Rajput. It has Price Waterhouse LLP as its auditoRs 
As on 30-06-2025, the company has a total of 766.79 Crore shares outstanding.HDFC Bank Share Price 
Today is Rs. 1957.40. On previous day, the HDFC Bank Share Price (NSE) closed at Rs. 1986.9, 
featuring among the most traded securities on the National Stock Exchange.Shareholdings:As of 30th 
Jun, 2025, the promoter held 25.52% of the stake in HDFC Bank shares, out of which 0.0% was 
pledged. On the same date, foreign institutional investors' (FII) holdings of HDFC Bank stocks was 
48.84% as compared to 48.3% in Mar 2025 with increase of 0.54%. The domestic institutional 
investors (DII) holdings on 30th Jun, 2025 was 35.76% as compared to 35.64% in Mar 2025 with 
increase of 0.12%. Out of the total DII holdings in HDFC Bank shares 25.61% was held by mutual 
funds. The rest including public held is -10.12%. HDFC Bank stock price is reflected on both the 
exchanges - BSE and NSE.Dividend, Bonus & Split Information:HDFC Bank Dividend: Ever since 1994, 
HDFC Bank dividends has been paid out around 30 times. As on 18 Jul, 2025, 03:59 PM IST, The 
overall dividend yield for HDFC Bank stands at 1.11%. The last dividend paid was on June 27, 2025 
(Rs. 22.0). The Earnings Per Share (EPS) for quarter ending 31st Mar 2025 is Rs. 92.32.HDFC Bank 
Bonus: The most recent bonus issue had been in year null around 0 years ago at 0 : 0 ratio. The 
first bonus issue was announced in null.Stock Forecast:After showing 120268.76 Cr. of sales and 
7.2% of quarterly net profit, there have been multiple ups and downs in the HDFC Bank stock prices 
in the past few weeks. For example, HDFC Bank stock price on 11th of July 2025 was around Rs. 
1983.7. HDFC Bank share price now stands at an average of Rs. 1957.40. Judging by last week's 
performance, stock is in up trend.HDFC Bank has a median target price of Rs. 2194.93 in 12 months 
by 40 analysts. They have provided a high estimate of Rs. 2770.0 and low estimate of Rs. 1627.0 for 
HDFC Bank share.Historical Prices and Performance:HDFC Bank, incorporated in 1994 is a Large Cap 
company (with a market cap of Rs. 1523537.76) operating in Banks sector.The Return of Equity (ROE) 
in last five financial years given by HDFC Bank stock was 13.56%, 14.03%, 15.89%, 15.38% and 15.17% 
respectively.The HDFC Bank share gave a 3 year return of 45.88% as compared to Nifty 50 which gave 
a return of 56.47%.HDFC Bank announced 2200.0% final dividend on June 27, 2025.Key Metrics:PE Ratio 
of HDFC Bank is 21.52Prices/Sales Ratio of HDFC Bank is 4.16Price/Book Ratio of HDFC Bank is 
2.85Peer Insights:Peers are businesses with comparable activities, buisness objectives and 
affiliation with a particular industry area. For HDFC Bank, major competitors and peers include 
ICICI Bank, Kotak Bank, Axis Bank and IndusInd Bank. As of Mar 2025, the dividend yield of HDFC 
Bank stands at 1.11% while ICICI Bank, Kotak Bank, Axis Bank and IndusInd Bank stand at 0.77%, 
0.12%, 0.09% and 0.0% respectively. The PE ratio and PB Ratio of the company are among its 
competitors stand at 21.52 and 2.85 respectively.Leadership of HDFC Bank :Atanu Chakraborty is Part

is Deputy Managing DirectorKeki Mistry is Non Exe.Non Ind.DirectorRenu Karnad is Non Exe.Non

ARTICLE 3: HDFC Bank Q1 net profit jumps 12% to Rs 18,155 crore; special dividend and 1:1 bonus issue of shares approved
Source: MoneyControl
URL: https://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/earnings/hdfc-bank-q1-results-net-profit-jumps-12-to-rs-18-155-crore-special-interim-dividend-bonus-issue-of-shares-approved-13297876.html
Content Length: 3,717 characters
================================================================================

HDFC Bank Q1 FY26 Results Trade Watchlist Portfolio Message Set Alert live bse live nse live Volume 
Todays L/H More × HDFC Bank, India’s largest private sector lender, on July 19 reported a 12.24 
percent year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 18,155.21 crore for the fiscal first quarter, beating 
analyst expectations. The bank's standalone net interest income (NII) expanded 5.4 percent to Rs 
31,438 crore in Q1 FY26. Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad Core net interest margin 
(NIM) for the quarter stood at 3.35 percent, down from 3.46 percent in Q4 FY25, reflecting faster 
repricing of deposits compared to assets. Operating expenses rose 4.9 percent year-on-year to Rs 
17,434 crore in Q1 FY26, compared to Rs 16,621 crore in Q1 FY25. This includes Rs 6,158 crore in 
employee costs and Rs 11,276 crore in other expenses. The cost-to-income ratio, excluding gains 
from the HDB Financial IPO, stood at 39.6 percent. Related stories RBL Bank Q1 profit slumps 46% to 
Rs 200 crore on higher provisions; CEO expects margin rebound from ... Yes Bank Q1 net profit jumps 
59% on-year to Rs 801 crore; other income, stable asset quality boost e... Total standalone income 
rose to Rs 99,200 crore from Rs 83,701 crore in Q1 FY25. Gross advances as of June 30, 2025 stood 
at Rs 26.53 lakh crore, up 6.7 percent year-on-year, while total deposits rose 16.2 percent to Rs 
27.64 lakh crore. The CASA ratio stood at 33.9 percent, down from 38.2 percent in Q1 FY25, with 
savings account deposits at Rs 6.39 lakh crore and current account deposits at Rs 2.98 lakh crore. 
Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad Capital 
adequacy ratio (CAR) improved to 19.88 percent from 19.33 percent in the same quarter last year. On 
the consolidated side, total income rose to Rs 1.33 lakh crore from Rs 1.17 lakh crore a year ago. 
Other income jumped sharply to Rs 21,730 crore, supported by gains from the HDB IPO. This included 
Rs 75.9 crore from fees and commissions, Rs 16.3 crore from forex and derivatives, and Rs 101.1 
crore from trading and mark-to-market gains. Insurance subsidiaries contributed Rs 1,645 crore in 
profit before tax. The gross non-performing asset (GNPA) ratio stood at 1.40 percent, while the net 
NPA ratio was 0.47 percent as of June 30, both slightly higher than the year-ago levels. Return on 
assets was steady at 0.48 percent. Return on assets stood at 0.48 percent in Q1 FY26, unchanged 
from the same period last year. Following the IPO of its subsidiary HDB Financial Services, HDFC 
Bank’s stake in the company declined to 74.19 percent as of June 30, 2025, from 94.32 percent at 
the end of the previous quarter. The lender also gained significantly from HDB, booking a pre-tax 
gain of Rs 9,128 crore from the offer for sale of shares. On the operational front, Operating 
profit stood at Rs 35,734 crore, while provisions surged to Rs 14,442 crore, including Rs 9,000 
crore in floating provisions and Rs 1,700 crore in contingent provisions. HDFC Bank ’s board also 
approved a special interim dividend of Rs 5 per share and a 1:1 bonus issue. The special interim 
dividend will be paid to shareholders whose names appear on the register as of July 25, and the 
payment is scheduled for August 11. The bonus issue, subject to shareholder and regulatory 
approvals, will entitle shareholders to one bonus share for every one held, with the record date 
set as August 27. According to a Moneycontrol poll, the Street had estimated a 7 percent YoY rise 
in NII to Rs 31,885 crore and a 7.4 percent rise in net profit to Rs 17,385 crore for the 
April-June quarter. Ahead of the results, on Friday, HDFC Bank shares fell 1.56 percent to end at 
Rs 1,959 on NSE.


================================================================================

--- Article 1 ---
Title: HDFC Life Results
URL: https://m.economictimes.com/markets/stocks/earnings/hdfc-life-q1-results-standalone-profit-rises-14-yoy-to-rs-546-crore-net-premium-income-grows-16/articleshow/122502983.cms
Content:
HDFC Life Insurance reported a 14% YoY increase in net profit, reaching ₹546 crore for Q1FY26, driven by a 16% rise in net premium income. The company's Individual APE grew by 12.5% YoY, boosting its market share to 12.1% overall and 17.5% within the private sector. (What's movingSensexandNiftyTracklatest market news,stock tips,Budget 2025,Share Market on Budget 2025andexpert advice, onETMarkets. Also, ETMarkets.com is now on Telegram. --- Article 3 ---
Title: HDFC Bank Q1 net profit jumps 12% to Rs 18,155 crore; special dividend and 1:1 bonus issue of shares approved
URL: https://www.moneycontrol.com/news/business/earnings/hdfc-bank-q1-results-net-profit-jumps-12-to-rs-18-155-crore-special-interim-dividend-bonus-issue-of-shares-approved-13297876.html
Content:
HDFC Bank Q1 FY26 Results Trade Watchlist Portfolio Message Set Alert live bse live nse live Volume Todays L/H More × HDFC Bank, India’s largest private sector lender, on July 19 reported a 12.24 percent year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 18,155.21 crore for the fiscal first quarter, beating analyst expectations. The bank's standalone net interest income (NII) expanded 5.4 percent to Rs 31,438 crore in Q1 FY26. Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad Core net interest margin (NIM) for the quarter stood at 3.35 percent, down from 3.46 percent in Q4 FY25, reflecting faster repricing of deposits compared to assets. Operating expenses rose 4.9 percent year-on-year to Rs 17,434 crore in Q1 FY26, compared to Rs 16,621 crore in Q1 FY25. This includes Rs 6,158 crore in employee costs and Rs 11,276 crore in other expenses. The cost-to-income ratio, excluding gains from the HDB Financial IPO, stood at 39.6 percent. Related stories RBL Bank Q1 profit slumps 46% to Rs 200 crore on higher provisions; CEO expects margin rebound from ... Yes Bank Q1 net profit jumps 59% on-year to Rs 801 crore; other income, stable asset quality boost e... Total standalone income rose to Rs 99,200 crore from Rs 83,701 crore in Q1 FY25. Gross advances as of June 30, 2025 stood at Rs 26.53 lakh crore, up 6.7 percent year-on-year, while total deposits rose 16.2 percent to Rs 27.64 lakh crore. The CASA ratio stood at 33.9 percent, down from 38.2 percent in Q1 FY25, with savings account deposits at Rs 6.39 lakh crore and current account deposits at Rs 2.98 lakh crore. Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad Story continues below Advertisement Remove Ad Capital adequacy ratio (CAR) improved to 19.88 percent from 19.33 percent in the same quarter last year. On the consolidated side, total income rose to Rs 1.33 lakh crore from Rs 1.17 lakh crore a year ago. Other income jumped sharply to Rs 21,730 crore, supported by gains from the HDB IPO. This included Rs 75.9 crore from fees and commissions, Rs 16.3 crore from forex and derivatives, and Rs 101.1 crore from trading and mark-to-market gains. Insurance subsidiaries contributed Rs 1,645 crore in profit before tax. The gross non-performing asset (GNPA) ratio stood at 1.40 percent, while the net NPA ratio was 0.47 percent as of June 30, both slightly higher than the year-ago levels. Return on assets was steady at 0.48 percent. Return on assets stood at 0.48 percent in Q1 FY26, unchanged from the same period last year. Following the IPO of its subsidiary HDB Financial Services, HDFC Bank’s stake in the company declined to 74.19 percent as of June 30, 2025, from 94.32 percent at the end of the previous quarter. The lender also gained significantly from HDB, booking a pre-tax gain of Rs 9,128 crore from the offer for sale of shares. On the operational front, Operating profit stood at Rs 35,734 crore, while provisions surged to Rs 14,442 crore, including Rs 9,000 crore in floating provisions and Rs 1,700 crore in contingent provisions. HDFC Bank ’s board also approved a special interim dividend of Rs 5 per share and a 1:1 bonus issue. The special interim dividend will be paid to shareholders whose names appear on the register as of July 25, and the payment is scheduled for August 11. The bonus issue, subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals, will entitle shareholders to one bonus share for every one held, with the record date set as August 27. According to a Moneycontrol poll, the Street had estimated a 7 percent YoY rise in NII to Rs 31,885 crore and a 7.4 percent rise in net profit to Rs 17,385 crore for the April-June quarter. Ahead of the results, on Friday, HDFC Bank shares fell 1.56 percent to end at Rs 1,959 on NSE.

--------------------------------------------------
